caption: Sunny day in the fall, so the line was long - but that's not their fault. A bit pricey, but again that's just a function of their location right on the river. Food was good, service was with a smile. Really liked the steak tacos - good flavor, and the cilantro was fresh.
Great food and drinks with astonishing views!

Stopped here on a Tuesday evening for dinner with a colleague.  Fortunately for us, it was Taco Tuesday!  (2 tacos for $9) I had four different tacos from their decent selection, and they were delicious. The location is right on the river, which makes for an awesome setting. They offer a nice selection of canned & bottled beverages (including beer). I would definitely eat there again!
Very nice venue to enjoy Chicago's Riverwalk and watch people/boats go by. Good southwestern fare. Friendly staff. It's outside seating...so covid friendly.

(Translated by Google) My experience in this place was good, it has a nice view, you can appreciate the boats and ships with tourists, however it is important to note that the attention was splendid, they followed the cleaning protocols and asked to wear masks at all times, I really liked the theme Of the purple color in chips and taco tortillas, it's a good place to eat when you're passing through Riverwalk, my negative point is that the meat for the tacos was very fatty and the guacamole needed more flavor. The pina colada and margaritas tasted good, so much so that we ordered two rounds. They will not have a bad time but if it is important that when choosing your orders you think about the extra calories ... ohhh I forgot, all their materials from plates to napkins are recycled. (Original) Mi experiencia en este local fue buena, tiene agradable vista, podrás apreciar los botes y barcos con turistas, sin embargo es importante destacar que la atención fue espléndida, seguían los protocolos de limpiezas y pedían llevar máscaras en todo momento, me gustó mucho la temática del color púrpura en chips y tortillas de tacos, es un buen lugar para comer cuando estés de paso por Riverwalk, mi punto negativo es que la carne para los tacos era muy grasosa y el guacamole necesitaba más sabor. La piña colada y margaritas tenían buen sabor, tanto así que pedimos dos rondas. No la pasaran mal pero si es importante que al elegir su pedidos pienses en las calorías extras... ohhh lo olvidaba, todos sus materiales desde platós hasta servilletas son reciclados. The pina colada and margaritas tasted good, so much so that we ordered two rounds. Worst guacamole and tacos in Chicago. Not good even for tourists.

Awful Experience. Me and my friends came here after a couple hours of walking and shopping, needing a quick refresher. We ordered 3 Mojito's. They had no alcohol, one of my friends went and asked for some alcohol and got it. When me and my friend went to ask, she said we would have to pay extra. I was annoyed. My friend, paid the  exact same as i did for the same drink, and now that I am asking to put alcohol in a drink that is supposed to have it, i was being blown away. It happened on Sunday, Sept. 6, 2:00pm.  We ended up walking away regretting ever coming here.

The views here are amazing and the food is so good. Staff is friendly and wants everyone to have a good time, plus location is perfect right at Michigan Avenue bridge. Live DJ creates fun, energetic vibe. Definitely recommend!

Had the best time at Beat Kitchen on the Riverwalk on Friday night.  Was there with family - adults and kids. The location is perfect.  Food and drinks were amazing.  The staff/team was so cool and kind.  And I felt they did a great job concerning distance of tables etc in light of Covid. Oh, and their music was on point. Will definitely be back.  Loved it so much!
This place has the BEST view, delish frozen margs, and the yummiest tacos!! Service is always on point, definitely going back!

I was between 2 and 3 stars. If I could do 2.5 I would. But I'm giving 2 because 3 is just too high. The pros: This place is right on the river, super casual, order your food/drinks at the counter/bar area, they give you your drinks right away and bring your food shortly thereafter to your table. We were there on a Friday night and they had a DJ which was cool, good music. Beautiful views as you eat. Staff seems very conscious about sanitation and keeping things safe amidst COVID times. The cons: this place can do much better!! It feels like it's just a spot that people will see first along the River walk and go eat there cuz it looks nice, and since there's that lure, they don't feel the need to impress via food or drink. The drinks and food are way overpriced for what you get...I understand this is on the river and that Chicago is expensive. Yes $14 is a pretty standard rate for a drink, but they literally poured the drink from a premixed pitcher and threw a lime on my paloma and a mint leaf on my husband's mojito. No. They should be making the drinks to order, or charge less. We got a variety of tacos and they were all just meh. $60 for a mediocre meal, and I won't be back. I honestly don't care if there's some price gouging for a good view/ambiance, but I want to still feel like it was worth it, that the food at least tasted great, but I can't say that for here. I would honestly save your money and either eat somewhere else along the river, or simply bring your own food and go just a bit further down the Riverwalk and find a spot to plop down and eat there!
Pleasant outdoor dining by the river. Tasty tacos on blue tortilla. I liked the rib taco the best with  topping. $6.
